description.en: Material collision with Emily Dickinson's 'A Bird came down the Walk' (~1862). Precise nature observation tipping into the uncannily beautiful — colliding with your prompt through a deliberately insufficient model.
description.de: Materialkollision mit Emily Dickinsons 'A Bird came down the Walk' (~1862). Praezise Naturbeobachtung, die ins Unheimlich-Schoene kippt — kollidierend mit deinem Prompt durch ein absichtlich unzureichendes Modell.

context.en:
COLLISION MATERIAL:
A Bird came down the Walk —
He did not know I saw —
He bit an Angleworm in halves
And ate the fellow, raw,

And then he drank a Dew
From a convenient Grass —
And then hopped sidewise to the Wall
To let a Beetle pass —

He glanced with rapid eyes
That hurried all around —
They looked like frightened Beads, I thought —
He stirred his Velvet Head

Like one in danger, Cautious,
I offered him a Crumb
And he unrolled his feathers
And rowed him softer home —

Than Oars divide the Ocean,
Too silver for a seam —
Or Butterflies, off Banks of Noon
Leap, plashless as they swim.

— Emily Dickinson, #328 (~1862)

Write a single text where the poem above and the prompt below become inseparable. Not a comparison. Not alternating. One text that cannot decide which material it is.
context.de:
KOLLISIONSMATERIAL:
A Bird came down the Walk —
He did not know I saw —
He bit an Angleworm in halves
And ate the fellow, raw,

And then he drank a Dew
From a convenient Grass —
And then hopped sidewise to the Wall
To let a Beetle pass —

He glanced with rapid eyes
That hurried all around —
They looked like frightened Beads, I thought —
He stirred his Velvet Head

Like one in danger, Cautious,
I offered him a Crumb
And he unrolled his feathers
And rowed him softer home —

Than Oars divide the Ocean,
Too silver for a seam —
Or Butterflies, off Banks of Noon
Leap, plashless as they swim.

— Emily Dickinson, #328 (~1862)

Schreibe einen einzigen Text, in dem das Gedicht oben und der Prompt unten untrennbar werden. Kein Vergleich. Kein Abwechseln. Ein Text, der nicht entscheiden kann, welches Material er ist.
